name: Masala Dosa
description: A crispy South Indian delight, served with a spicy potato filling, accompanied by coconut chutney and tangy sambar.

name: Aloo Paratha
description: A traditional North Indian dish made with whole wheat flatbread stuffed with spiced mashed potatoes, served with curd and pickle.

name: Poha
description: A popular breakfast dish from Maharashtra, made with flattened rice, mustard seeds, turmeric, peanuts, and garnished with fresh coriander and lemon.

name: Idli
description: Soft and fluffy steamed rice cakes, traditionally served with coconut chutney and sambar for a wholesome breakfast.

name: Chole Bhature
description: A North Indian favorite, consisting of spicy chickpeas (chole) paired with deep-fried fluffy bread (bhature).

name: Puri Sabzi
description: Deep-fried puris served with a spiced potato curry, a popular breakfast in many parts of North India.

name: Upma
description: A savory semolina dish made with mustard seeds, vegetables, and curry leaves, commonly enjoyed in Southern India.

name: Medu Vada
description: Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, these savory fried lentil doughnuts are served with chutney and sambar.

name: Thepla
description: A popular Gujarati flatbread made with whole wheat flour, fenugreek leaves, and spices, served with pickle or curd.

name: Besan Chilla
description: A healthy gram flour pancake cooked with chopped onions, tomatoes, and spices, often served with mint chutney.

name: Dhokla
description: A steamed savory cake made from fermented rice and chickpea flour, garnished with mustard seeds and curry leaves.

name: Sabudana Khichdi
description: A light and flavorful dish made with tapioca pearls, peanuts, and mild spices, often enjoyed during fasting.
